properties.Operator: Wallenius Wilhelmsen Logistics (WWL) Vehicle Services Canada Ltd.
properties.Desc_: Wallenius Wilhelmsen Logistics (WWL) is one of two automotive terminals located on the Fraser River.

properties.Operator: Wallenius Wilhelmsen Logistics (WWL) Vehicle Services Canada Ltd.
properties.Desc_: Richmond Auto Terminal is one of two automotive terminals located on the Fraser River.
Fraser Surrey Docks is a multi-purpose marine terminal handling containers, and breakbulk commodities such as general cargo, logs, steel, machinery and project cargo.

Lynnterm is the consolidation centre for forest products, steel and breakbulk in the Pacific Northwest. It handles wood pulp and paper, lumber, panel products, steel products, project cargo, and machinery.

Lynnterm is the consolidation centre for forest products, steel and breakbulk in the Pacific Northwest. It handles wood pulp and paper, lumber, panel products, steel products, project cargo, and machinery.
Fibreco is a terminal that handles wood pellets.

properties.Operator: Kinder Morgan Canada Terminals Limited Partnership
properties.Desc_: Kinder Morgan Westridge is a petroleum terminal handling crude petroleum, petroleum products, and jet fuel. The terminal imports and stores aviation turbine fuel for delivery to Vancouver International Airport via Kinder Morgan’s jet fuel pipeline.

properties.Operator: Kinder Morgan Canada Terminals Limited Partnership
properties.Desc_: This wharf offers services for bulk shippers moving products to and from all regions of Western Canada and the Pacific Northwest. It handles bulk mineral concentrates liquids, sulphur/fertilizers, specialty agri-products and other dry bulk commodities.

Lantic Inc. is the leading refiner, processor, distributor & marketer of Rogers Sugar brand products in Western Canada. The terminal also handles & distributes other sugar products throughout Western Canada, in addition to handling bulk raw sugar imports.
Pacific Coast Terminals is the world's largest and most automated export sulphur and bulk liquids marine terminal. It handles sulphur, canola oil and ethylene glycol.

West Coast Reduction is a leader in the rendering industry, operating technologically advanced rendering plants of fat and oil products. It handles inedible tallow, feather meal, poultry meal, blood meal, fish meals, and fish oil, and exports canola oil.
Neptune Bulk Terminals is North America's largest multi-product bulk terminal. It handles metallurgical coal, potash, and bulk fertilizers.
Westshore Terminals is a coal and coke (fuel with few impurities and high carbon content) export terminal.
Centerm operates six gantry cranes on two berths, on-dock rail facilities and an advanced operating system that tracks a variety of containerized cargo in real time.

Deltaport includes 10 gantry cranes and handles containerized cargo. Deltaport is currently Canada’s largest container terminal, with three berths, on-dock rail facilities and the only quad lift crane in North or South America.
Vanterm has six gantry cranes, on-dock rail facilities for containerized cargo, and handles containerized cargo, project cargo and bulk oils from the adjacent West Coast Reduction facility.
Alliance Grain Terminal is a leading Canadian farmer-directed agri-business and one of Canada's largest grain handling businesses. It handles grain and grain products.
Cargill is a grain terminal and one of Canada's largest agricultural merchandisers and processors. It handles wheat, durum, canola, barley and grain by-products.
Cascadia is a grain terminal that handles wheat, durum, canola, barley, rye, oats and by-products. Viterra Inc., who owns Cascadia, operates Canada’s largest grain handling network.
This is a small grain elevator and agricultural trans-loading facility. Specialty grains are unloaded from rail cars into the elevator, then reloaded into containers for export.
Pacific Elevators handles canola, flax, peas, wheat and other grain products. Viterra Inc., who owns Pacific Elevators, operates Canada’s largest grain handling network.
Richardson International is a major exporter of canola and cereal grains to trading economies along the Pacific Rim. It handles wheat, canola, barley, rye, flax, grain, and special crops.
Chemtrade is a chemical terminal that imports bulk sea salt and exports caustic soda and sodium chlorate, used in the bleaching process of paper products.
IOCO is a petroleum terminal handling heavy fuel oil, and marine gas oil.
Shellburn is a petroleum distribution terminal that handles petroleum products.
Stanovan is a petroleum terminal that handles petroleum products.
Univar Canada Terminal handles caustic soda solution and ethylene glycol, and is the leading chemical distributor in Canada.
Ballantyne is one of two Vancouver cruise terminals and is located east of the city centre, adjacent to the Centerm container terminal.
Canada Place is home to the port’s cruise terminal and is located in the Vancouver city centre, close to shopping, dining, and attractions.
